description: Rene Perez, 20, and Oscar Perez Jr, 21, were arrested in Texas after attempting to stuff a safe in a car. The homeowner called 911 after receiving a motion-activated alarm on his cell phone.
title: Two Texas men are arrested after homeowner watched them stuff a safe in a car
title_page: Two Texas men are arrested after homeowner watched them stuff a safe in a car | Daily Mail Online
text:
Two men have been arrested after trying to stuff a huge safe into the back of a car.
Rene Perez, 20, and Oscar Perez Jr, 21, fled on foot, but were apprehended after a short pursuit.
Authorities responded to a report of a burglary Thursday afternoon when the home owner called 911 around 2pm after he received a motion-activated alarm on his cell phone.
The homeowner was able to provide a physical description of the suspects when he called 911 after observing them on his cell phone surveillance camera
Oscar Perez Jr (left) and Rene Perez (right) fled on foot, but were apprehended after a short pursuit on foot
The homeowner observed three suspects on his cell phone via surveillance camera and provided descriptions of the men to the 911 operator.
According to the Hays County Sheriffâ€™s Office, law enforcement was on scene within one minute of the call and the officer saw the men trying to load a large safe into a car.
It's unclear if the two are related, but both are Hays County residents from the Kyle and San Marcos areas.
Rene Perez, who has prior arrest records, was arrested in 2013 for failure to appear in court as promised and was ordered to pay a $360 fine.
Deputies said a third person was also arrested, but was not involved in the burglary and has been cleared.
The sheriff's office said the two will be charged with felony burglary of a habitation.
